Reviews.Title: “Good hotel next to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Svein_Oslo
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a decent hotel in the immediate Termini area, this hotel is an ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Piemonte Rome for a Day”
Reviews.Author: Rogie T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in here overnight after 7 nights in Florence, just to rest for a day before leaving for Manila. Compared to Globus Hotel in Florence, the room we got here was a little bigger, the toilet was big. But there was no safe for valuables unlike in Florence, we had to lock up our luggages even for just a walk around the neighborhood. The staff was helpful, but not very friendly. They did not serve ice for drinks, which in Florence was available 24/7, also hot water was sparse , here the concierge gave but was not too happy having to get up from his seat. Advantages of the hotel, it is near Roma Termini and the metro stations. Breakfast was spartan, coffee was watered down. Unlike in Florence someone was there to operate the big espresso machine for you, but here there was no one. However, when the employees reported for work, they went straight to the machine and made themselves cappuccino and espresso, including the chambermaid! To us patrons, we thought we had to pay extra for espresso or cappuccino, in Florence it was free and there was a barista who prepared it for you and served it to you during breakfast. I wish the staff were more hospitable, or are they all like that in all budget hotels in Rome? Another thing I could hear the traffic outside, and the people quarreling on the street maybe over parking space or a collision. Few channels on TV, fell asleep watching Ben Hur in Italian!

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DSNH19
Reviews.Content: The Piemonte Hotel was a great bed and breakfast to explore rome! The room was very clean and the maid was in every morning to make our beds, change the towels and empty bin etc. You get a mini bar in the room also but beware they obivously do charge if you take anything, as they dont advise about this upon check in! The Breakfast was great, great selection of hams, rolls, yogurts, fruit etc! we filled our bellys every morning for the day a head! The hotel was around a 20 minute walk to the colosseum but you have the termini station approx 3 minutes walk from the hotel where you can grab one of the metros or even one of the tour buses! i have some great reccomendations for restaurants we ate in... Babbos- this is approx a five minute walk from hotel and was fantastic!!! Great food and great prices, have a look on trip advisor for the name of the street! Mamma Angelas- this was also a great restaurants.... might be the best lasagne ive ever tried!!! this was only on the next sreet, so again another 3 minute walk! We only stayed 3 nights so the hotel was PERFECTO!!!!! GRAZIE PIEMONTE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “mrs nicholson”
Reviews.Author: 938charlotteN
Reviews.Content: me & my husband stayd at this hotel for 7nights we had it booked fore months, realy looking forward to going, when we arrived at the pemonte hotel it seemd ok, untill we went to the room, the room wasent located in the hotel it was outside & around the coner, we had a bunch of keys to get in & out the room you had to go threw 4,doors with locks before we reatch our room, the room was verry small and un,clean ther was no window it was like a prison cell, verry noisey with young people in & out all night, breakfast was ok, realy thort i should share this report to others as my holiday was spoild, & wouldent like enyone elce to exsperance what we did, rome is a stunning city fantastic to see but the (PEMONTE) hotel would defantly not recomend,

Reviews.Title: “Close to main station, but a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: the_cat_returns
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Piemonte for 3 nights with my partner a week after valentines to avoid the busyness and escalated prices.i had quite high hopes for the hotel as I had done my research and found that through photos and reviews that this was a lovely hotel in a great location. Now I definately can't knock the location, it was just a 5 minute walk to termini the main station that links you to a number of metro stations throughout Rome. Most of the time we found that we didn't need to travel via metro anyway as central rome is best enjoyed by walking everywhere which we pretty much did and within 2/3 days I would say we saw everything we wanted to see in and around the city. So the hotel was quiet accessible for walking around Rome to the main attractions which was nice but I was a little disappointed. From outside our hotel it looked Really nice and the main reception too definately looks as though it warrants the 3* status. However I was disappointed with our room. It was very small,old fashioned and although it looked clean it didn't feel that clean. Our bed was made every day but they didn't give us fresh towels. When I asked to use a travel adaptor the receptionist was very nice and helpful and they let us hold our bags there for the day when we checked out as our flight wasn't until the evening. Breakfast was ok, again a little disappointed as previous reviews had definately made it sound better than it was. Packet croissants, bruised fruit and watered down juice were on the menu but they did have nice whole grain rolls with cheese and ham if you like it continental. Overall was a nice hotel and was a good place to go if your on a budget. However next time I come to Rome I would like to pay a little more and stay somewhere a bit nicer. There are some great restaurants nearby as we found out during our last full day, so try out trattoria - mamma Angela's which was lovely for authentic reasonably priced food

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Dotcouple
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable and the shower had good pressure. The breakfast was standard. The best thing about this hotel is that it is very close to the train station. The only problem was that the room was very warm even with the thermostat set as low as possible. We had to open a window to be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip despite the weather”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome with wife and friends to see England v Italy Rugby and sightseeing for total 4 nights. This is an ideal hotel for sightseeing. It is just a couple of minutes walk from Termini from which it is fairly easy to use metro,bus or tram to see all the sights. Despite some reviews stating area was a bit seedy I didn't find this at all and in fact we ate in excellent, and reasonably priced local Pizzerias or Trattoria's (different one every night)- all less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is great value. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, and whilst small compared to some are exactly what you'd expect from this type of small city centre hotel. Didn't have lot's of contact with staff but found them friendly. Breakfast was ok - basic coffee,cereals,pastries and ham/cheese- but did have difficulty getting a table in firts morning. For a 2 to 4 night city centre trip where basic comfort,location and price are all of consideration I could not fault this hotel and would stay here again if visiting Rome. In terms of Rome my only disappointment was the weather with worst snow for 25 years meaning the outside attractions were closed and watching the rugby was freezing !

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Maria F
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to Terminal Station, where you can take the subway, train or bus. Very nice breakfast, with bread, pastries, yoghurts,juices and expresso. The room isn't very big, neither is the bathroom, but it was enough to me. Comfortable bed, clean sheets and towels, AC worked. Friendly staff. Overall a great hotel to enjoy all that Rome has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lankk97
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days in December. This hotel is reasonably priced & very close to Termini. We needed a decent place to stay during our first visit to Rome. Our room rates did not include breakfast but due to its proximity to the Termini, this is no issue at all. The room is generally clean but noticed some hair in the shower when we first checked in. The staff was not exactly very friendly. They just gave us the keys when we checked in so we had to ask them for a map as this is our first visit to Rome. A contrast to all the hotels I went in London, Paris and other parts of Italy who were so welcoming and gave us tips and information without us having to ask. An ok place if you are not too particular. Just be wary when you walk from the Termini to the hotel as the street is quiet and there may be unsavoury characters. One of the nights, a man followed us down the street. We stopped and pretended to look at one of the closed shops and took a good look at his face. That spooked him and he turned back towards Termini.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Robinson53
Reviews.Content: Having closely read the trip advisor reviews, I carefully chose this hotel for a 3 night stay in January and was certainly not disappointed. I booked direct with the hotel via their own website and received a 10% discount, which meant our double room, ensuite, cost just £47 per night for 2 people, including breakfast, an absolute bargain! On our arrival staff were extremely helpful and we were politely directed to our room on 2nd floor. The room was clean, comfortable and warm, with a perfectly adequate ensuite shower room, albeit on the small side. Our room was serviced every day and our towels were changed daily too. Breakfast was served from 7am til 10am, perfect for us late risers, with a good selection of cereals, bread rolls and cold meats. The hotel is also conveniently close to the Terminii, so we were able to quickly make our way there, following our arrival at Fiumicino airport and it was equally convenient for our departure too. I would unreservedly recommend this hotel to fellow travellers, it's not 5 star luxury, but it is a very good 3 star at an excellent price and following my experience I would book again with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christ-and-Rebecca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Piemonte over the Christmas period for a week. Upon arrival we where told that our room was in the block round the corner. When we entered our room, which was on the third floor, we found that that the room very comfortable for the four of us, and in the bathroom there was also a jacuzzi. The room was impeccable clean. Breakfast was adequate, ham, cheese, salami,croissants, variety of cakes,cereals, tea, coffee, milk etc. The hotel is 5 minute walk from Termini station We would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ULISSE12
Reviews.Content: As a native of Rome, Italy, I must say that this hotel is in a great location. 5 minutes walk away from TERMINI, Rome's main train station. From there you can hop on many buses and the two subway lines that will take you anywhere you want to go in Rome. Just do yourself a favor though, do not use the subway between 7 to 9 am or in the evening between 5 and 8 pm because the trains will be super crowed, unless you enjoy lots of physical contact.....LOL. My room was very small. the size of a closet, but also very clean. I found the pillow to be very small and thin, so I used the bed cover to prop up my pillow. The morning breakfast was good, except for the blond Eastern European waitress, she was quite unfriendly to some of the customers. But the price and quality and location where great, so I would stay there again. Hopefully, by then, the blond waitress will have sweeten up a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Banjo_Pug
Reviews.Content: Close to Termini Station and in a quiet side-street, this hotel is clean, comfortable and conveniently situated for sight-seeing Rome. The room was fairly small and dark with a tiny bathroom but for a one-night stay this didn't matter to us. It was good value although the breakfast was fairly basic and the dining area is very cramped. We returned for a second night at the end of our stay in Italy and we would recommend it. On both occasions we visited a restaurant a little further along the road called Trattoria ILioni d'Abruzzo - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in rome”
Reviews.Author: lazeedaysMidlands
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in November for 3 nights - we found the hotel very clean and comfortable - as previously mentioned the shower cubicle is tiny! but thats my only gripe about the room.Breakfast is adequate although we did struggle to get a table one morning. Location is perfect for sightseeing being so near to the station - we used the tube and also the buses and managed to see a lot whilst we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MaryWotNoGuinness
Reviews.Content: We just returned after 5 nights at the Piemonte. Since this is low season, the price was perfect. The hotel is situated 2 minutes from Termini Station, on a quiet road. The staff were very polite, helpful and speak good english. Room was on the second floor, overlooking the road. Pretty quiet. Very clean. Not big, but it was big enough for two people. The bathroom was small, especially the shower cubicle. I'm not sure if that would be pleasant for a big person. Towels were changed daily. They also provide you with soap, shower gel/shampoo, and shower caps. My only complaint here is that the water was not very hot, but I'm used to steaming hot water, so maybe it's a matter of preference. It was warm enough though. TV has a couple of satellite channels if you want to watch english-speaking tv. The breakfast was perfect. You could choose from many different things, cakes, croissants, bread, butter, honey, many flavors of marmelade, cheese, ham, salami, fruit, milk, coffee, tea, juice. The orange juice was the only thing I didn't like, it was more like water with sugar and a bit of orange color and flavor. But the rest was pretty tasty and good enough to start a day of sightseeing in Rome. There was free wifi that worked in our room too. There were also two computers in the lobby with printing facilities. I don't know if those are for free, but we used one computer to check in online for our flight and we also printed the boarding passes, and noone asked us for money, so, I guess it must be free. If you arrive earlier than the time specified for check-in, or have a lot of time between check-out and departing from Rome, you can leave your luggage at the hotel and spend those hours in Rome without having to worry about dragging your suitcase with you all day. The proximity to Termini is very convenient, especially if you are planning to visit other cities by train. The area is not that bad at all. We felt safe. You could see a couple of seedy characters, but those were right at the station, nowhere near the street where the hotel is situated. But after all this is a train station, and all train stations are like that. Nothing dangerous though. We would definitely go back, this is a very good hotel at a very convenient location and an excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - we'll definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: Giovanna40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for a couple of nights and were really pleased. We had a quadruple room which was larger than I would have expected - the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great and the location was excellent.We used the hop on hop off bus which conveniently stopped at the end of the road near the station. We would definately come here again and would reccommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One night”
Reviews.Author: ervegard
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piemonte is a 3 star hotel. I haven’t got much to say about this hotel as I only stayed here for one night. Reason being was because we were taking an early flight so we needed to be close to “Termini”, Central Station. The hotel was fine, standard and with a friendly receptionist. Rooms were pretty nice, good size and clean. The area was good and we felt safe. As we were leaving early in the morning we didn’t get to enjoy the breakfast that was included. Here is a fantastic cityguide: http://www.backpacking.se/ReadArticle.asp?ArticleId=251&SubMenu=2 If you only have a day: http://www.frommers.com/destinations/rome/0064020766.html

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: bezza1968
Reviews.Content: Triple room was excellent- enough space for the 3 of us and very clean. Clean towels every day and an abundance of toiletries. Breakfast - typical continental, cereal, fruit juices, pastries, cheese/ham, yogurts, coffee/tea (enough to start the day). Location - 2 mins from Termini and approx 20/30 minutes walk from main tourist sites. I would definately stay here againbg

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: travelophile99
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have already mentioned, this hotel is in a good area quite close to the Termini. But the room was sooo small we could hardly move around after putting in our luggage. The mattress too was not so good, I sat on the edge n just slid down :(.. I have to mention the shower stall...beware if you are a big person...u can just about squeeze in...never came across such a cramped shower stall again in the rest of our Europe trip. Breakfast was just ok..if you are a vegetarian your choices are really limited...you would be bored with it in one day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: Mnanne
Reviews.Content: We were moved here from Hotel Madison as they did not have a room for us, even after reservation and coldnt be happier! The atmosphere here was much better, just a stone's throw away from the station and main bus stand, great location for Rome! The beds were comfortable, bathroom was clean and spacious, quiet neighbourhood, but close to essential places for a tourist. the breakfast was very minimal and the staff dont speak much English and aren't the friendliest, but the receptionist was very helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: M_Granada
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a great deal! The staff was helpful and very close to Termini Stazione. A few blocks away, there's also a grocery store where my boyfriend and I bought most of our food for the stay when we were not eating out. The only drawback was having to deal with the loud whiny inexperienced American travelers who we see in the breakfast room in the mornings (and this is coming from an American).

Reviews.Title: “hotel piemonte good value and roomy and clean”
Reviews.Author: theburren
Reviews.Content: my brother , sister-in-law and i stayed here for three nights. when we arrived they sent us just around the corner to a large brown wooden door on via dei mille, 6. they provided an entrance key. we took an old fashioned caged elevator to the 3rd floor. the key admitted us into the corridor for the hotel rooms. our room was number 5. we were so pleased to find a double and 2 twin beds. the bathroom was large and our room was very spacious. had 3 good nites of sleep and 3 good breakfasts. location near termini was convenient. this street was not noisy. had thick sound proof windows and room darkening shades, a/c. was very very clean. booked room through wego for discount.

Reviews.Title: “Convience of the Location”
Reviews.Author: hobocat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Termini train station(3 city blocks). The staff was very friendly. We arrived early but they were ready for us. Our room was about 50 meters down the street. It was on the third floor and was very nice. The elevator was from the 20's but very neat. We made ourselves familiar with the area and took-in a couple of the sites. We saw the Piazza de Repubblica built on the location of the Baths of Dioclectian which were built in 398 AD. We also visited the church of Santa Maria degli Angeli. After a nap, we walked to the church of St. Maria Maggiore which has a relic of the manger where Christ was born. As you can see, this was a great base. Restaurants were close. After our first stay, we traveled around Italy and then came back to this ame hotel. As in the first stay, everything was great. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, lacks facilities”
Reviews.Author: thehealster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the hotel. The check in was a bit slow and we were sent to a seperate building around the corner where they had taken a floor and created individual rooms. Having said that the room was spotless and surprisingly quiet. There are no facilities at the Hotel, ie Restaurant, Pool etc but the location is superb, near the Terminus and open top bus stop.If you are looking for somewhere simply to be a base, it fits the bill

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: tainapio
Reviews.Content: We had a room for 3 persons in the dependance which was 200m away from the hotel. The room was very clean, had a new marble bathroom with jacuzzi and both were large.A lot of fresh towels, soap, shampoo, minibar, safe. We didn't miss anything! We had no balcony, but a window and airconditioning was working perfect (Aug 35 degrees). Breakfast was good for Italy, with cold cuts, muesli, yoghurt, croissants... We would go there again, for that price its was unbeatable, close to Termini (Walking distance 5 min with luggage). People at the reception were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, near the train station”
Reviews.Author: hot_devil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from termini and has an elevator. The room was very small, there was hardly any room to maneuver with two pieces of luggage. Breakfast area was crowded and cramp. They omitted to mention that we were entitled to a proper cup of coffee like espresso or cappuccino for breakfast. Located near termini, it is convenient to make use of public transport. There's also a supermarket at termini. There are very few attractions reachable on foot from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very accessible and homey”
Reviews.Author: lauryn88
Reviews.Content: We certainly enjoyed staying at the Piemonte Hotel in Rome. It was very accessible to the train station and since we did not have a car, it certainly met our needs. We had a balcony outside of our bedroom, wonderful to take pictures. It was very clean and homey. We would definitely stay there again. It exceeded our expectations. Roberta and George(ONTARIO)

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you don't mind sleeping in a hot room”
Reviews.Author: hogan1381
Reviews.Content: The price was good the room clean, the breakfast was small but ok and the staff was very nice, but if you are from a cooler climate you will roast in the room, very poor airconditioning.

Reviews.Title: “close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Mattah
Reviews.Content: close to the termini station, which made it convenient to change from national railway to airport shuttle train. Nice lobby. Small room though.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean hotel, tiny room, close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Lahr177
Reviews.Content: I had been staying on the outskirts of Rome with friends, but as they left a day before I did, I chose to spend my last night at the Piemonte Hotel. Great location, very close to the Termini. I left the hotel at 8am and got on the 8:22 train to FCO with no problem! (A warning though, the FCO trains leave from track 28 which is a hike from the main train platforms). The Manager at the hotel was very welcoming when I arrived, as check in wasn't till the afternoon, he arranged to keep my luggage for me. When I came back later in the day I didn't even have to give my name, he brought the luggage out directly and took the time to explain how the room key/lighting/etc worked. I had a single room and it was tiny, even by comparison to other hotels I've stayed at in Europe. It was even smaller than my dormroom from uni days! However the location, and the price, were both good, the hotel is very clean and has good A/C. There is free WI/FI. For a night or two, this a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight stay if you need to be near the Termini”
Reviews.Author: Monny1
Reviews.Content: I wont waste words on ehat has probably been written before 1000 times over but will address what people may be looking for in a few words. Why stay here - its a 3 min walk to the Termini and not overly expensive Staff - Rude and incompetent Rooms - extremely small Bathroom - shower Ok for a child, adults may squeegee themselves dry exiting the shower Beds - like most Italian beds - rock hard Essentially unless you are carrying heavy luggage to the Termini there is no logical reason to stay here as there is nothing of note near it, the staff find the clientelle an inconvenience, and you will get a better breakfast in the bin outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: macman64
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located in almost central part of Rome (close to Termini station). Clear room, nice staff and good breakfast. Although distance from station was not more that 300m, the street was not so noisy. Air condition works good. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, good location and staff”
Reviews.Author: aussiesteve83
Reviews.Content: Good location, staff were helpful. Only stayed the one night, average all round. Secure rooms and rooms are spacious with the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect adequate if you're looking for accomodation near Termini”
Reviews.Author: WITraveller251
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Piemonte hotel in November, and it met our limited needs. The staff didn't exactly go out of their way to ensure we were comfortable or happy, but they responded to our requests and answered our questions when we posed them. Our room was clean and small, which is what we expected from the location, but really lacked in charm. The area near Termini is far from beautiful or interesting, but it provides easy access to a lot of transportation options if you're intrepid enough to use them, or ambitious enough to walk. My husband and I walked easily to/from the Parthenon area from this location, and found it quite easy to navigate with the simple map provided free by the hotel desk manager. There's not special about this hotel, but it delivers what you'd expect from a budget hotel near a giant train station.

Reviews.Title: “a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: vangel1981
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed there for 3 nights.Simple and modern rooms,very helpfull staff,very nice breakfast but a little bit noisy.For 2 nights we stayed tothe residence piemonte a very big room but the aircondition didnt work so they changed as a room but this room was just perfect plasma tv perfect bathroom...i recommend this hotel to everyone and dont forget the low price...

Reviews.Title: “Stinking drains made me ill.”
Reviews.Author: anne_abelle
Reviews.Content: The stench that rose from the shower drain made me ill, it was unimaginable. It was clear that the hotel knew of the problem from, firstly, the overpowering smell of strong chemicals in the bathroom and secondly, the reaction of staff, yet they sold the room as if it was acceptable. Reception told me a change of rooms was not possible and tried to 'fix' the problem with more strong chemicals. I was feeling strange from the chemical smell, let alone the disgusting sewers. In the end, I stomped a wet towel over the shower drain and threw up all night. Never again. Absolutely disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you're on a budget...”
Reviews.Author: Vegan35
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the pros, since overall I thought this was an OK hotel. It's less than a five minute walk to Termini station, making it easy to get around. There's a Hop On, Hop Off tour bus and an airport shuttle literally right at the end of the street. The location itself is OK, but there's nothing too interesting to do in the immediate area. However, if you're a vegetarian, vegan or just enjoy healthy food, The Beehive hostel right down the block has a very small restaurant that serves daily breakfast, weekend brunch and snacks the rest of the time (no lunch or dinner, unfortunately). One morning I got tofu scramble with veggies, homemade bread and jam, a large soy cappuccino and water, all for 9 euros. The Piemonte offers an included breakfast, which I'll talk about in a sec. They also have free wi-fi in the rooms or there's a computer to use in the lobby. And they will loan you plug converters and umbrellas. Despite what other people said, I found the staff to be pretty helpful and fluent in English. Now the cons: While the room seemed clean on the surface, we had an ant problem in our bathroom (room 220). At least they weren't bed bugs, I guess. The room was small, yes, but not too bad. I mean, how much time are you really spending in there anyway? They originally tried to give us a room in a building down the block, but we refused because it meant we had to walk outside to get to the breakfast room and front desk, etc. We investigated the other building at one point, and it seemed kinda sketchy with a dirty lobby, a rickety 1800s-era elevator and a wide open door with seemingly no security. If anyone has ever stayed here, I'd be curious to know what the actual rooms were like. Anyway...the other negatives were the fact that you could hear everything going on in the hallway - mainly the cleaning people, who started their duties every day around 8 a.m. and didn't seem to finish till 1 p.m. I'm not sure what took so long. And while breakfast is included, we were pretty over it by the third or fourth day. It's basically just bread/pastry, meat/cheese, whole fruits and cereal. Nothing's cooked and there's no toaster for the bread. Also, the beds are hard, the pillows are weird and the towels are like sandpaper. All that said, this place is decent if you're on a budget and aren't expecting any frills. Would I stay here again? No. But it was fine for what it was and how much we paid.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: knightme99
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was not friendly. The room was very basic without any amenities; The bed has hard. There was not a box spring, just the top mattress. The front desk staff advised us that all the rooms have the same standard bed. The complimentary breakfast was not worth enduring the noise level from the staff banging dishes around. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: CarolW66
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had an enjoyable 2 night stay for 108E/night. The location was great-5 minute walk from the train station/bus area in a decent looking neighborhood. The room was good size, nice bathroom with a full size bathtub! The staff was very helpful-told us the best bus to take to Villa Borghese. Free use of a computer was very nice. We had dinner at the restaurant they recommended -Ristorante Regina on Via Mille-good and not expensive. We had lunch at a pizzeria around the corner the other way on Via Mille-2 large pieces of very good pizza and a bottle of water for 8E! The only small negative was the hair dryer was VERY weak. The morning we left before breakfast was served, the gentleman prepared 2 cornetti with jam for us to take .Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: madamgeneva
Reviews.Content: Very small hotel but clean and friendly. The room is tiny, I had a double room and i'd read that rooms were small but I really wasn't prepared for how small the room really was. For a single person it's fine but if i was sharing the room then it would have been a problem. Room was also spotless, so not complaints there. The hotel itself is clean and offers a free continental breakfast which is nice and clean. The hotel is a 2 minute walk away from a few restaurants and a bar (The Yellow Bar) which I recommend as it's cheap, friendly and filled with english speaking people. Overall, a nice stay. Safe area also.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to station”
Reviews.Author: moonflower59
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Rome on way to Amalfi Coast so needed somewhere close to Station (Rome Termini). This hotel,only 200 metres away, was clean, comfortable and appropriate for this purpose. Only problem was free wi fi didn't work in our apartment (there is a hotel section and apartment section), however, for the cost and location it wasn't a major drama. Staff were helpful and spoke good English, breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: alison303
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Piemonte was as good as expected for the low price. The rooms were clean with adequate space and facilities. The front desk was more than helpful in addressing any questions or concerns we had. The hotel is very convenient to the Termini train station, but is a bit of a walk to the sites and good restaurants. If you want a cheap hotel in the Termini neighborhood, consider the Hotel Piemonte.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C!!!”
Reviews.Author: JuLu111
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Piemonte Hotel and the A/C was broken the ENTIRE time. At first they denied that anything was wrong... the A/C was pretty much non-existent and in the middle of the night they would cut the entire air flow. The rooms were so hot and suffocating that we would be woken up multiple times in our sleep. We complained about it on the first and second night... no response from the hotel. Finally on the third night we stormed down to the lobby and they finally admitted that the A/C was down and that they were going to get it repaired. Well, that never happened during our stay and we feel that they should have gotten to this matter sooner when many more guests (besides us) were complaining of the same problem. Come on, this is Rome in the middle of August! It was unacceptable. The breakfast was sub-par, the ham smelled funny and the cereal milk was served warm. The only thing about this place was that it was close to the central Termini station, so very covenient if you plan to take the bus and/or metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great balance between cost, comfort and proximity to city centre.”
Reviews.Author: Saunakrai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had taken two rooms. The hotel is 5 min walk from the Termini stattion and is very cosy and comfortable. Breakfast was included in the room rent and though nothing fancy it was adequate for a starting a day of sightseeing. The staff were very polite and were always glad to assist us with our sight seeing query. There were plaenty of restaurents around the hotel so all in all we were very satisfied. We had a baby and a baby cot was provided without any additional cost. All in all our ROme experience was enriched by the stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: majmani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Piemonte for 3 nights in August, and our stay was pleasant. I had set my expectations minimal while travelling to Rome, hence was not disappointed. Hotel is about 200-300 meters away from the Roma Termini station,which is a positive point. The bus station as well is about 300 meters away, and you can always take the public transport to move around in the city. Hence, accessbility wise, it was good. We checked into the hotel in the afternoon. The gentleman at the reception was welcoming, and spoke in decent english. He checked us in within 5 minutes, and room keys were handed over. The elevator works fine, so no worries about carrying the luggage upstairs. Room was decent enough in size. I mean, for a couple the room size was sufficient. I could open the blinds and windows to let the sunlight in. The only thing i did not like about the room was the wash room. The cubicle for taking shower is quite small and you might actually feel claustrophobic! Breakfast was very basic, There was only one lady working in the breakfast room. She was setting up the table, cleaning, washing, re-filling the food. I thought it was too much for one person to take. Moreover, the way dishes were being thrown around, we got a feeling that she doesn't like people sitting in the breakfast room and dirtying her dishes. But we later realised in other restaurants that this is a norm in Rome. Dishes are usually thrown around which to us was very irritable! There are couple of restaurants within Via Vicenza which offer good food, and excellent service. If you come out of Piemonte hotel, and take a left, avoid the restaurants on the main road! The service was so pathetic that sitting for 15 minutes, we and all other people there did not even receive the menu / their order. We decided to leave and round the corner (on the right hand side)saw another restaurant. Excellent food, excellent service. If i go back to Rome, i do not mind staying in this hotel. It is clean, affordable, and despite the shortcomings of the shower room, it is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you ask for...”
Reviews.Author: JHBg
Reviews.Content: For all those people out there who complain about the size of the rooms - you get what you ask for. Before we booked the hotel for a three night stay with our family of four (a three year old and a one year old), we were confused by the conflicting reviews about the sizes of rooms. I contacted the hotel to ask whether we could all fit, and the lovely Roberto promised that there would be enough room for all of us. We arrived very early in the day, about 8:30 after an overnight flight from Hong Kong and asked if we could check in early. Again, the staff were friendly and direct - yes, they could check us in early at no cost, but we may not get the big room we need. So we waited until about 11, and got a fantastic room. This room had been extended at the back so essentially there was a second room added on, with a single bed, wardrobe and desk with TV. We were also given a great portable cot for the baby at no extra cost (a good quality brand, and it seemed hardly used). If it had not been for the extension we would not have fit in.... but with this, we had plenty of space for us and our luggage. OK, the bathroom (and the shower cubicle especially) was a tight fit, but I have been in smaller other European countries. The breakfast was basic but sufficient, and the staff kept smiling while our mini-monsters threw yoghurt and crumbs all over the floor. On the last night there, my three year old got sun stroke - the staff provided clean sheets for her and even lent us a thermometer - I really wonder what else they may have been hiding behind the front desk if I had asked for it! There is a good sized supermarket about two blocks away, and we did most of our supply shopping there. We drank only one bottle of water from the minibar (which, at 1 Euro, was not cheap but not any more expensive than would be charged around the main attractions in Rome) and when we went to pay for it at checking out, they told us not to worry about it! Overall, we discovered that Rome in the summer time was not the best stopover choice with little kids, but the hotel made it as bearable and pleasant as it could. The only thing was the aircon was not strong enough to cope with the heat. PS - we did see a couple of weirdos around the Termini, but did not feel threatened at any time. And being so close to Termini, there are lots of good transport options if you don't feel like walking to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, central in rome, very close to all attractions, worth staying there”
Reviews.Author: 1979elaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. It was across the road from the terminal for the hop on hop off buses. The staff were very friendly. when you are going to see all the major attractions like the vatican etc it is worth while paying to go aound with a tour guide as they will have loads of infor etc. The guide compay we went with is romaround tours, and our guides name was Ian, very funny scottish fella. They have guided tours around all of the attractions and are quite cheap. My boyfriend and I had a brilliant time in rome and will defo be heading back .

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Pictures”
Reviews.Author: DCJAM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean. However, the room had peeling plaster and looked NOTHING like what they're showing on the website. The single room was about the size of a dorm room for ONE. Friendly staff but pictures of accommodations are misleading to say the least. It is close to the Termini and you can catch a bus (The SIT) to the airport for only 8 Euros. If amenities are important this is NOT the hotel for you. NO room service, no extras. Although I felt safe, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service!”
Reviews.Author: chrisy_90
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant stay at Hotel Piemonte. It's located two minutes from Stazione Termini (Rome's main station) so there is easy access to the Metro and also two minutes distance from a sightseeing tour bus. The room was thoroughly cleaned and tidied everyday. All the staff were very friendly and keen to help, e.g gave us a map of Rome and spent time showing us which places would be best to go within the amount of time we had. Buffet breakfast was served in the morning for no additional cost. Brilliant hotel, well worth recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ws963102
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at the Piemonte. Chose this hotel based on reviews and location. The location was GREAT! Just a short walk from the Termini which made it easy to visit the major tourist locations. We were a little annoyed when they told us our room was in a different building around the corner, however the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us directions several times, warned us of bad restaurants causing food posioning, and arranged pick ups for or tours. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: its_tuc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. It is located across the street from the Roma Termini (train station). So it was very easy to get to from the airport. Just take the leonardo express train and its about a 20 minute ride. The hotel itself is small and clean. Our room was small....the bed took up most of the room. But all that was important to me was that the room and bathroom were clean....and i was very satisfied with that. The reception was friendly and the breakfast is very basic. When in Rome, you don't plan to stay in your room for very long....so I would consider this a very good hotel for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with Hotel Piemonte”
Reviews.Author: RodandChez
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piemonte was just perfect for our four night stay in Rome. We booked Hotel Piemonte on-line from Australia after reading many reviews and checking the hotel's location to all the attractions we wanted to see in Rome. This was our first trip to Rome and we had been told by friends to not expect too much from the hotels in Rome unless we wanted to stay and pay '5' star. We did have a budget we needed to stick to, but we also wanted to stay in a real Italian hotel and Hotel Piemonte was perfect. It's location to all the major tourist attractions is excellent - and particularly if you like walking, but if you don't the train station is at the end of the street - but you wouldn't know it, once inside the hotel you don't hear a thing from the street, we slept extremely well every night. We walked everywhere - even to the Vatican City - the location is perfect for restaurants etc., but the street itself is amazingly quiet at night. Our room was small by western standards, but we expected that, but it was very adequate for our stay. The room was very clean and was serviced everyday. The breakfast was more than enough to get us on our way (we had also been 'warned' not to expect too much for breakfast). We had cereal, fruit, yoghurt, breadrolls, cheese, and tea/coffee - which is more than we normally eat at home - so no complaints about the breakfast at all. The only negative we should mention was the attitude of a couple of the front desk staff - they seemed a little gruff, or impatient with tourists, which we thought was rather strange as tourists would be their main source of income we thought. But then again, they were very efficient, perhaps they'd had enough of westerners speaking bad italian - who knows - it didn't bother us too greatly, but it did surprise us considering these guys work in a hospitality industry. The rest of the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. All in all it was a wonderful experience and we would certainly stay at Hotel Piemonte again if and when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, wonderful people, wonderful guests”
Reviews.Author: alm5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 days at this Hotel. We were so nervous that it would not be a good choice for our family. We booked two rooms. One for my husband and I, and another for our three girls. The rooms were large enough, had extra space for large suitcases and ample room for teenage girls. The bathrooms were small but very clean. The hotel was very clean. The breakfast was wonderful. The staff went out of their way each day to help us. Two blocks from Termini, Walked in the area every night , never had a problem. Great resturants in the area too! A pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mssuperclean
Reviews.Content: i was reluctant to reserve this hotel since it was in the train station area but looking at the description and the pictures, i decided to finalize my reservation. the hotel is indeed on the quiet side of the termini station which made us feel safe at night. the walk from the airport train (arrives on track 25) to the hotel took us around 15 minutes and 5 minutes from the entrance of termini to the hotel itself. upon entering the hotel, the receptionist made us feel welcome and checked us in right away even if the check in time was at 2pm. the lobby is quite small and there are 2 computers for use by the guests. in the breakfast room, there was a pretty good selection of bread, cereals, jam, ham, and cheese. as a whole, the ground floor is well-maintained and clean. now to the room..it was clean, too, small but not crowded. there is a small fridge, and a closet. the tv doesn't offer so much english channels except for cnbc and cnn. thank god for the wooden floor, the room looked cleaner than if it were carpeted. the bathroom is clean and the towels were changed everyday. i thought the shower was really small..there was hardly space to move..as long as there was hot/cold water, it was not that bad. the double bed was comfortable that gave us a good night's rest. i got what i paid for and it was worth staying at the hotel piemonte.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary and nice”
Reviews.Author: Chris-sofia
Reviews.Content: It's a nice and small 3 star hotel, perfect for a short stay in Rome. It's pretty close to Tremini station, which is an advantage. The rooms are kind of small though, however clean and cosy. The staff is very responsive and ready to assist you every time you need something. The only problem we had was that the bathroom heater was so mighty, that at a certain point the temperature in there reached like 35 degrees and there's no option for you to turn it down or whatsoever (which is not that bad if you wanna use the bathroom as sauna, but still.... :) We asked on the reception if someone could do something about it, they did it with lagging (only on the second day they've turned it down). Breakfast - absolutely simple and uniform, however not so bad indeed - bread (which was really good), jam, cold cuts and cheese. The coffee on the block table sucks - if you are a coffe drinker (like me) you should order one from the bar, as it's a way better. In general I consider the hotel as a good alternative for the money you pay. Enjoy - Rome is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, clean and centric”
Reviews.Author: Star3779
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent; you get all information you need from the reception. We stayed for a long week-end and we found it perfectly centric, the train station is at 5min walking, the same for metro. The room was clean and comfortable. It offers a rich breakfast with a real good Italian coffee. We had a real good time there. Price is really good. I hardly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine with me”
Reviews.Author: jjkdc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night. I wanted to be near Termini to make it easy to get to the airport the next morning. This place is about 2 blocks away. Since it was off-season, I got a great rate on a double room (single use). The room was on the small side, though I've certainly stayed in smaller ones while in Italy. It was spotlessly clean and equipped with a minibar. The bed was reasonably comfortable and there was plenty of hot water when taking a shower the next morning. It's nothing fancy, but a good value for Rome. I may well stay there again some day.

Reviews.Title: “only benefit is proximity to termini station”
Reviews.Author: havingadventures
Reviews.Content: The single sized room in this older hotel was the size of a closet, airless and old. The hotel staff did not go out of their way to extend a welcome or to suggest sightseeing excursions or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jue121
Reviews.Content: Pro - Clean room. A/C in our room works really well. - Very close to train station. - Friendly staff. - Value (310 Euro for 3 nights in early October) Con - Our room was in a different building, we had to make a short walk outside to get to the hotel (ie: to get hot water, breakfast in the morning etc). - No English channels. - Breakfast wasn't the best, as other reviews have mentioned, the juice was really bad. Just stick with coffee and croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night only”
Reviews.Author: kgholtz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night, which was the last night of our trip. The hotel is within walking distance from the main station Termini. The area around the train station can be a bit seedy. The hotel itself is not near any attractions. We chose it because it was cheap and near the train station, so we could get to the airport early the next morning. We came from the port via train so it was basically for convenience. The room was small and dark, but fine for the one night. The bathroom was small which is expected. I would not make it your home base if you are staying in Rome for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: tinatot76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. We were going to be in Rome for one last night at the end of our trip. The hotel is within walking distance from the main station Termini. The area around the train station can be a bit seedy. The hotel itself is not near any attractions. We chose it because it was cheap and near the train station, so we could get from Florence back into Rome and than back to the airport in the early morning. The room was small and dark, but fine for the one night, the staff was helpful and the breakfast wasn't anything great, even by European standards. Important to note is Rome only has two metro lines both running out of the main station Termini, so getting around via metro was super easy being so close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dasherdo
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed in by far, great food and great service and very in expensive.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: aussiedude121
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piemonte is a couple of minutes walk from Roma Termini if you walk in the right direction - or its about 15 minutes walk if you take the wrong turn like we did. The room we stayed in cost 100 Euros per night, including typical continental breakfast. Our apartment room was actually around the corner from the hotel reception, but although the old fashioned lift scared us, the room was actually fairly modern with a nice clean bathroom. I would consider it good value considering Romes prices. Plenty of food places and shops close by. Station, Bus depot and hop on hop off bus all within a couple of minutes walk. It seems a pretty safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, clean and not badly priced”
Reviews.Author: SallySA
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel through www.hotels.com, we struggled to find the hotel from Rome Termini but only because we were on the wrong side. Once we found our bearings, the hotel was approximately 10 minutes walk from the front of the Rome Termini building. We stayed at Hotel Piemonte for 2 nights and did not find the staff to be of the most helpful - the person at the front desk was not very helpful with tourist information and if you are in your room during the afternoon, your room will not be cleaned. On arrival however, the room was neat and reasonably sized with a small bathroom. Breakfast was not bad, offering a selection of cereals, bread rolls, juice, cold meat, cheese, preserves and coffee - nothing fancy but good enough to satisfy a hungry tummy. We found the bus station just down the road had stops for tourist buses as well as the bus to the airport. A supermarket, McDonalds and other restaurants were all within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price, great breakfast, hard bed”
Reviews.Author: misudad1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the end of April/09. The hotel was 10 minutes walk from Termini, therefore very convenient. With the seniors discount, it was also a good price (117 euros/night). The room, on the second floor of the "main" part of the hotel (they have overflow rooms around the corner somewhere, which we did not see), was average size, had a nice bath with shower, was very clean, and the maid service was good. The hotel was well-maintained, and the staff were quite helpful when we needed them. Their internet cafe of 3 PC's was free and available, and appreciated by me. The breakfast, eaten in a cheery and bright room, was great, with 2 types of dry cereal (good granola and some kind of a flaked cereal like corn flakes which we did not try), several kinds of pastries, great rolls, several kinds of cheeses and meats, lots of jams, peanut butter and nutella spread, and some fruit -- which was not quite up to the standard of the other parts of the breakfast. Coffee, hot water for tea, and hot milk were available, The juices were a bit watery, but still OK. The only issue we had was that the bed was too hard (a comment I had seen from others), but for only 3 nights, considering the location and price etc., it was OK. The street was reasonably quiet, we felt safe at all times. I think we would strongly consider staying here again, especially if they get softer mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: italiana07
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was pleasant. They were very helpful in directing us to certain locations, had a great breakfast in the morning and the rooms were nice. Very safe neighborhood, quiet and would certainly recommend to someone traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great professional and clean hotel with nice breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: dogsledgirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the guys behind the desk spoke perfect English, which helps a lot! They were very nice and professional, well dressed and friendly. Our room was very nice, spotless clean with our own bathroom. The breakfast in the morning was a bit bumped up from all the other hotels we had stayed in so far in Italy. Even though we didn't think breakfast was a big deal, it really helps to have a good start to the morning, and you don't have to run out of the hotel looking for something to eat immediately! Beds were comfortable, and they had nice towels. They also had CNN in English on the tv. I am not a big TV watcher, but it's nice to be able to see what is going on in the world when you are traveling. The hotel is in a great location only a 5 min walk from the main train station. Neighborhood seemed to be safe even at night - we never had any problems. Highly recommended hotel! And I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: northern_buffalo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was cheap, spotlessly clean and close to the metro and the station. Whilst it isn't in the Spanish Steps area you don't pay those prices and you certainly get good value for money. The hotel is one of the best looking in the area after walking round and seeing some of the others. Being close to the station gives you access to both Metro lines and lots of busses so if you're not planning on being in the hotel much this is a great area to be. The staff were friendly and polite and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was good and there were internet connections in reception. To sum up, you pay for what you get and with this hotel you get everything and more than you would expect and is a great place to be based for a trip to Rome. I'd highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Forrest1559
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Piemonte fantastic contrary to other reviews. It was only a few streets from the main termini station and was easy to find and well within walking distance. The staff were pleasant, courteous and more than helpful. Breakfast was a typical European fare consisting of bread, ham, salami, cheeses, cerials, etc and was fine. The room was very clean and quite spacious. I happened to glance in other rooms as staff were in cleaning and all appeared similar. I read other reports about the small size of Roman bathrooms but ours was huge with a good shower and well apointed. One evening we decided to get the bus to Piazza Navona but was unsure which bus to get. The gent behind the front desk, who spoke fantastic English by the way, was incredibly helpful. He told us which bus to get on there and back and even drew a map of the route and where to walk once we got off the bus. The only way he could have been more helpful was to have escorted us there personally. Overall, the hotel exceeded our expectations and i recommend it and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A stay at the Piemonte”
Reviews.Author: gloucestershirelady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piemonte, Rome for six nights. The room and bathroom were adequate but the bed itself was extremely hard, uncomfortably so. The breakfast was ok - our main complaint is the attitude of the staff - who were absolutely so unfriendly it isn't true! They did not connect with their guests at all - our other concern was that there was a problem with the lock on our bedroom door. It was obviously faulty, and it took ages everytime to gain access - we thought it was just our room but noticed that another couple on the same floor were having the same problem. All in all, slightly disappointing - quite well placed for travel into the city but a 'dodgy' area in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “I am disgusted with this hotel's online booking associations ....”
Reviews.Author: Amanda H
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel - I enquired, through an online booking system that required a credit card, as to whether or not they had availability. I received an automated response telling they did, but thought nothing of it as I had decided to stay in a different place - Hotel Capo de l'Africa - FABULOUS by the way ... During my stay at the Capo, I received an automated email from Piemonte to say that as I had made a CONFIRMED BOOKING (which I had NOT), they would be charging my credit card for a 24 hour stay (85€). I responded to say that I had not made a confirmed booking, to which they replied telling me that I had clearly not understood the system but that it isn't their fault .... HOWEVER I HAVE NO CONFIRMATION EMAIL from them because if they HAD Confirmed, I would have immediately written to cancel ... I am furious with these people ....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: yvonnecolebert
Reviews.Content: We just returned from at trip to Italy, and stayed at the Piemonte hotel for two nights. The location to the train station is excellent, very easy to find. The room was clean, air conditioner worked, the breakfast was the usal with good supply. I definitely reconmend this hotel for the location and the the front desk were very helpful as well. It was also a good location to catch the bus and metro to the Vatican and surrounding area. Not unhappy with it at all........mind you, we don't go out at night.

Reviews.Title: “YUK!”
Reviews.Author: iwishAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not pleasant. No air conditioning, one of our rooms smelt like there was a dead body in the room and it is in a very dodgey part of town. One conversation under our window was "do you have a gun", replied with "Yeah". We were told not to head right of the hotel at night, not safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: CLM_TAM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in July. Hotel was very easy to find from Termini station, we arrived early and our room wasn't ready - but there was somewhere to leave our luggage and somewhere to change after the flight. Hotel was clean and simply decorated - air conditioning in the room was bliss as it was way too hot outside!!! We didn't experience any problems with noise - either from the street or from adjoining rooms (but this may be because our room faced the back of the hotel and was at the end of the corridor!!!) Staff were friendly, breakfast was just OK. The location was ideal as a base, walking distance from most of the main attractions (but we did use the metro - which was really easy!). Overall I think this hotel represented excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: K&L092906
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in early May, in a double room. The hotel was a bit difficult to find from the train station, but very close. It was raining, and we had to avoid the rifraf who were selling umbrellas in the street. Our room was in a separate building, a half block away. We were a little leery, as we had to walk up several flights of stairs, or use an old elevator. But the room was very nice, and recently renovated with window coverings that kept the sound and light out. Continental breakfast was decent. The hotel is in a very good location. You can walk to all the major attractions, or take the metro from the train station to get to the Vatican. We left our luggage in the luggage room until the evening (heading to an airport hotel), although the front desk staff seemed reluctant at first to allow us to leave if for that long.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jenrich
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as it was close to the railway station. Room was actually around the corner from the hotel entrance on the third floor of another building. Room was extremely clean, spacious and there was no problem with road noise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This was good value considering what you receive from other hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LRLR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for our 5 night stay in Rome based on the reviews on tripadvisor. We were very disappointed with the overall service provided. I will write the review by categories: STAFF: The staff at the hotel were far from helpful, aside from booking you in and out of the hotel. They barely said hello and offered no tourism advice, even after being asked directly. They have tourism papers behind the counter, but don't offer to give it to you. I just happened to notice them on our 2nd day. The night staff member (older gentleman) that everyone on the board talks about was not there for most of our stay. He was there on our 5th night, which was too late. We overheard him directing another couple and he sounded very helpful. HOUSKEEPING/CLEANLINESS: Our room was very small, but clean. However, on 2 of the 5 nights, we were missing towels and toilet paper. When we called downstairs to request the items, we were not offered an apology. We did open our mini-bar on the first day and found an open half empty item in it. BREAKFAST: Breakfast is perfectly fine. The woman who makes the coffees is nice. Breakfast items included: yogurt, fruit, 2 types of cereals, juices, milk, pastries, buns, coldcuts, and cheese. Specialty coffees (espresso, cappucino) are included. LOCATION: The location is pretty good. Very close to termini station, but still quite a walking distance from most of the major sites. OVERALL: I would not stay here again. For the money that we paid, this hotel is not worth it. Had we paid less, I would have been less angry with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Brightontravels
Reviews.Content: A fantasic medium sized hotel in the Termini area. Rooms were spotless, Spacious & Not at all noisy. No interal noise what so ever and the electric shutters on the windows blocked all street noise. As for the person who said the breakfast selection was poor??? Well you have the usual Ham's, Cheeses & Breads Also croisants and pastries, Fruit, Cerals, Coffee's & teas. That's a excellent selection to me! The staff were extremely friendly! The night porter has a wealth of information. I would stay at this hotel again without a moments thought. Rome is a fantastic city! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Tourist29
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotel Piemonte in december 2006. The hotel has a good location. It's near the Termini Station (you can walk from there to hotel). The room was OK. It was clean, with nice bathroom. Maybe the walls were a little bit too thin, so I could hear people from the hall. The people (personnel) at the hotel were very kind!! I recommend this hotel to travellers who visit Rome for few days and want to stay in a nice hotel, at good location (you can walk to the city center or use a nearby metro or bus) and for fair price.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsl123
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel in great location, but internal noise at night a real problem. The paper thin walls really let this hotel down. Great staff, very helpfull. Hotel was full and we couldnt get in to breakfast as there was not enough tables for everyone to sit. Bathroom smells at night are terrible. Have stayed here twice, but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piemonte for 1 night before and 2 after a week in Tuscany. The location is excellent, a short walk from the Termini train station. The rates are very reasonable. We were on the first floor both times and were told those rooms were larger by friends who stayed on the third floor. Room 111 has an extra large bathroom with shower and tub. The facility is clean and comfortable; breakfast is basic (cereal, rolls, cold meat and cheese, juice, coffee, tea, but no fruit). The front desk staff is helpful and knowledgeable. The legendary Giovanni who works at night, tries his best at English and is very entertaining. Mama Angela and Regina Restaurants are very close by, reasonably priced, and have good food. Ask for Ali Baba or James Bond at Mama Angela. We walked to the Coliseum and took the bus from Termini to the Vatican. I have already recommended this hotel to friends going to Rome in November and would certainly stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: UrbanSuper
Reviews.Content: This 3* hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Termini Station, perfect when arriving from the airport by train. Probably not the best area in Rome, but as long as you don`t call up on the wrong people there is no reason to feel unsecure (and the police where present all the time). Anyway, within walking distance to famous views as the Vatican and Colosseum, and close to Piazza Venezia, the centre of the city. And of course a junction to all transportation facilities. I compared several hotels and location, price and of course reviews where the most importent criteria. And I can definitly recommend this hotel. It is placed in a quiet street, no problems sleeping with the window open, but no need to because of air condition in the room. Nice rooms, clean and with satellite tv. And very pleasent, high ceiling and thick walls made it comfortable to sleep. Staff is very helpful, breakfast is ok and computers with internet available. So I enjoyed the stay very much. HAPPY TRAVEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol&Gerard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May with friends to celebrate their Silver Wedding. The room we had led onto a huge covered in terrace - I think it was part of the breakfast terrace at sometime. We used this for evening drinks and to have our early morning cuppa before breakfast (take your own kettle as there isn't one in the room). The room was very clean, bed was comfy, ample of storage space for a 3 night stay. The bathroom was a bit 'snug' but clean and the shower was powerful. Breakfast was ok, nothing startling but adequate to set you up for a day's sightseeing. Staff were friendly especially the reception ones. Being very close to the Termini didn't bother us, it was very convenient, yes there were some tramps around but they were docile and didn't pester us at all. We used the metro only on one day and my husband had over 200 euros stolen from a zipped pocket in his trousers within 20 seconds of getting on the VERY packed metro. Not a very pleasant experience. Second time we used the metro we witnessed another pickpocket in action - this time a very small boy (around 7yrs old) had taken a wallet from French tourist's bumbag, which was underneath his poloshirt at his front!! In future I would rather walk. Lots of lovely restaurants can be found near this hotel - locals and tourists alike use the Nazarreno (I think that's what it's called) - fabulous food, excellent service and quite reasonable. Il Trimani wine bar is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel is excellent too - the wine menu is almost an inch thick and prices for a bottle varied from around 10 euros to many many euros!! Lunch was lovely there too and staff were very friendly. All in all, I'd return to Rome and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back, but it was "Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piemonte is located five minutes from Termini's train entrance, with several excellent restaurants nearby. The location is great if you are arriving to Rome by train as we did, and if you will be using the metro or buses. Unfortunately for Hotel Piemonte, their close proximity to Termini equals noise. Even at five blocks away, the moped, car and tourist traffic next to this corner hotel equals a lot of night time noise, just when you are trying to sleep away your aches and pains. Also, there is major construction going on about 500 yards away from the hotel and jackhammers started around 7 AM (great alarm, I guess). The beds were HORRIBLE, even compared to the other crappy twin beds I slept in in Venice, Florence and Siena, these beds are so HARD that I would liken it to sleeping on the floor, that's how hard they are. The maids never changed the sheets during our six night stay, either. The bathroom as I'm sure you can expect was not roomy. I had trouble getting into the corner shower, and the commode was so close to the sink that I leaned to the left every time I sat down to pee. The hair dryer was like a vacuum cleaner and didn't dry hair, so bring your own (but you can't plug it in in the bathroom, so you'll dry your hair sitting on your bed). The breakfast was average, but the "rich variety of salumi and cheeses" was pressed deli ham and some provolone. I went with the brioche and yogurt, which is a lot better than U.S. yogurt. They don't ask you if you'd like some, but they do offer cappochino or espresso free of charge (we found out on our fourth day, thanks). Service at the counter was pert but polite, but the older gentleman at night, which some described as charming, was kind of nutty. Nice and helpful though, and gives you these little slips of paper with directions to attractions and what bus to take. Finally, a word to all my American friends looking for a hotel with air conditioning: THIS AIN'T IT. The temp was in the mid 80s F when we were there and asked about the air. The reply was, "we haven't turned it on yet," though they advertise it on their website. If you are using this review as a gauge as to where to book in Rome, let me tell you this: this place, with all its crappy quirks, is average. I've stayed in worse places in Rome. The location is good if you can get around the street vendors and beggars loitering around Termini all day and night. If you want some place quiet, I suggest the Aventine Hill. I paid 150 euro a night for this mediocre hotel, and I know I could've done a lot worse. Roman hotels and hospitality is very different and can be shocking compared to American standards, so be prepared to either suck it up or paid more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacko062
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piemonte has a very good location, its near the Termini station where you can take the metro and the national trains to any place in Italy. Our room and toilet were very clean, but the toilet fan wasn't working. Nice simple breakfast and the Legendry Giovani will be there at night to give you seom tips for the next day. The most important thing is to avoid the area between the hotel and Termini after around 10 PM. If you fly with Easyjet or Ryanair to Ciampino, you can take the Terravision bus from the airport to Termini station and then walk to the hotel in few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “The location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 5 minutes walk of the main termini. The terravision bus from Ciampino airport stops here and is 13.50 euros return. We were two single women and did not have any issues or feel threatened returning to the hotel. A taxi to the centre, which can be ordered through reception is about 8 euro. The walk would take 10/15 minutes. We utilised legs, the open top bus tour, the metro and taxis to visit the locations, all easily accesible and good value. The hotel is absolutely fine, with friendly helpful staff, and yes the rooms are small but are clean and fully equipped, including a fridge, with a better than good shower. Breakfast is included (book with the right web site)and is what you would expect cold meat, cheese, cereal etc. It does not have a stocked bar but there is a very nice bar/restaurant just around the corner. Overall this hotel is very good value for a city centre, if a little outside the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ken 1235
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 11-14 Oct 2005. The hotel was very clean but basic and the room was just bigger than a cupboard. Continental breakfast was good. Overall, quite pricey for what you got. Went to one of Giovanni's reccommended restaurants (Dino's) and got ripped off. Food was terrible. Hotel was well situated and within walking distance of all the major tourist sites. We enjoyed walking along the side streets to the area around the Trevi Fountain, where there are some good restaurants. Would stay at the Piemonte again if they halved the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom smelled like a sewer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of September. When we checked in everything seemed to be alright so we put our bags in our and went out sightseeing for the day. When we returned to our room we noticed a bit of a smell coming out of the bathroom but decided to close the door and deal with it in the morning. At about 2 am the smell was overwhelming and neither of us could sleep. We tried to open the window, however the windows were automatic and someone on our floor had blown a fuse. At 2:30 not being able to handle the smell anymore I went downstairs to talk to the manager. To which he responded saying that he knows that room has been having problems and it tends to happen when the weather changes. He could not put us in a different room because the hotel was sold out. In the morning we went to talk to the manager to move rooms and he just laughed and said a lot of people have problems with that room. We asked for a discount and all he offered us was 20 Euro off the room and never even apologized. To make matters worse they just rented out that room to someone else the following night. This hotel is very close to Termini which is great if you need to take an early morning train but can be a bit of a dodgy area to walk through at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcrichton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piemonte Hotel for 5 nights in the middle of September 2005 and found the hotel to be excellent in all respects. Good location not far from Termini Station. The rooms and public areas were all spotlessly clean - our room was situated on the first floor at the rear of the building and was very quiet. The staff were all very polite and helpful - especially the famed Giovanni who is a one-man Rome tourist office with all his useful information. The continental breakfast was more than adequate and there are several good-value restaurants located in the Via Vicenza and adjacent streets if you turn left when you leave the hotel and head away from the Termini. We would certainly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a good-value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Rome, Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bezantandmurrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Piemonte during the month of May. It was my first trip to Rome and I stayed there based on the reviews posted on this website. I was, like everyone who reads about it, very leary of the fact that it was near the train station. But I had no problems and like any large city anywhere in the world you have to keep your wits about you. I walked the two or three blocks to the hotel at 10 pm and had no problems, although I will say the that station has some unsavoury looking characters. My advice would be to just move with a purpose. If you need help approach the police or the helpful station employees wearing the orange coloured jackets. Tell the others your fine and if need be use some colourful language. When I got to the hotel I was great by Giovanni the desk clerk. He's about 65 yrs old and all that the reviews said he was. He was so kind and helpful to me. I wanted to go for a walk after I had checked in and he was ready with slips of papers for sights, restaurants, bars and the like. He warned me about going near the train station at night and gave great directions to everything. My room was small, but very clean and comfortable. Just perfect, as I was in Rome and was there to see the city and not my room. The hotel was clean and it wasn't noisy at all.
