(My room faced the street) The staff in the hotel was very nice and the breakfast in the morning was basic. Tea, cereal, cheese, ham, pastries. One thing though the orange juice is not what I'm used to. I walked all over Rome and had a great time. Giovanni's restaurant recommendations were great. I ate in small family run places and the food was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. And will stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location depends on your itinerary”
Reviews.Author: mackyUK
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel but the whether it’s a good location or not depends on your itinerary. First, the positives…The hotel is well kept, very clean, adequate breakfast, helpful staff, close to Termini station if you plan to use the local transport and very good value for money The negatives…There are only a handful of decent restaurants around the area of the hotel and no bars at all, meaning walking further into the city, which is not that far but - walking back later at night means passing Termini where there are lots of gypsies, junkies and thief’s. The Romans keep a very clean city (which is a good thing), but the price to pay is a large amount of noise through the night, and with the hotel being near the Termini a lot more cleaning is required meaning a lot more noise. Even with the windows closed. If you plan to spend your evenings just having a meal and then having an early night, then I recommend this hotel. Otherwise I would look elsewhere, away from the Termini

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Piemonte Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulineTaff
Reviews.Content: After flying Easyjet and hopping on a bus directly to Termin from the airport (€13.50 return) we walked 50 yards, turned left and hey presto there was our hotel. The station was on the opposite side when we exited the bus. There is a supermarket inside the main station but the cheapest one is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Exit the hotel, take the first right and across the square is the supermarket and a couple of restaurants. Rome is very expensive (€4-5 for a diet coke in some places) and the restaurants are not too good and expensive so the supermarket was brilliant. Roberto was the man on the desk, very polite, friendly and answered all our questions. We were there for 5 nights. The hotel was immaculate and although the rooms are small they offer everything you need plus a hairdryer. The lounge was very comfy with leather sofas, a chair (3) and 2 computers for the internet. There appears to be ramps for wheelchair users and a downstairs toilet big enough to take a wheelchair plus a lift. Breakfast was continental but had everything to fill you up. The milk was not sour on any of the days we stayed (5 of them) and the choices were yoghurts, rolls, ham, cheese, pastries, cornflakes, muesli and jams etc. Tea, coffee and herbal teas. Not bad for a basic breakfast. There was even a bar in the dining area for anybody wanting a drink in the evening. Giovanni was a little overzealous with bits of paper with bus routes, sites to see etc but he was a mine of information and was most helpful. He just wanted to ensure we all had a good time but could talk so fast it was sometimes difficult to understand him. ALL the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful even down to the maids. The hotel is in a great location and we were able to get around the city with no problems. The metro entrance smells of urine so we used the main station and walked through. There are lots of homeless people and beggars and watch out for the pickpockets outside and on the metro (women with babies in arms etc). There was a little noise from late arrivals but nothing to write home about. The rooms had great electric shutters to keep the heat out and with the t.v. and mini-bar we could relax late at night in privacy. It wasn't expensive compared to most hotels I enquired about and this is low season so most Romans are on vacation. In high season the cost nearly doubles. I would definitely recommend this hotel - being British we are down to earth and tend to go with the flow - this is probably why we had such a good relationship with the staff. Well worth the stay if you don't mind basic, clean accommodation with easy access to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “We would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is its location, only four blocks from Termini Station -- which my husband and I used every day to get around Rome. (Incidentally, the neighborhood seemed fine to us, not "scary" as we read in some reviews elsewhere.) The rooms were very clean, yet simple -- very much like a college dorm room. The biggest problem we had was with the service. We made a point to be very polite and to speak Italian. The man at the front desk during the day time was very rude. When we checked in, he said our room would be ready in 15 minutes, but we ended up waiting in the small lobby for 45. Then, I asked to use the Internet for 15 minutes -- one of the services that the hotel provides -- and he set me up at a station. (The hotel controls the user name and passwords.) After 5 minutes, the system said I ran out of time. When I returned to the front desk and politely told him that the computer shut down, he very rudely said he was too busy to help me and I'd have to return later. He was also very rude to us when we checked out. At the other end of the spectrum was the nighttime desk clerk, who was very friendly. So friendly, in fact, that he called into our room the night we arrived, asking us what our plans were for the next day, and he would help us with transportation. Never mind that we were dead asleep when he called, suffering from jet-lag. Also, the breakfast was not worth the money. The milk was sour each day and the selection of food was awful, compared to other places we've stayed. We would not return to stay here, plus it was very expensive in June. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place lived up to many of it's "Excellent" ratings. The staff was very freindly and helpful, but Geiovani is a legand, he was the best! Everynight you come in he'll greet you and give you little pieces of paper that have all of his recomendations as far as sites, places to eat, and train and bus information. Some might not like it due to it's being located by the train station, but that is what makes it so cool! With in a few steps you can catch a bus, get on the metro, hop on a train, taxi...it's all there. Plus there is always a stir of action going on and you can really get a feel for downtown life "Rome Style", you can even head over for that late night graving for Gelato. I'd stay here again in a heart beat! Just a little advice, yes there are beggers and pick pockets that hang on ya (always be prepared, but not scared), but when you get off the traing (coming in from the airport) go to the right when you enter the main walkway of the station and take the side exit, then turn left on the street, take your next right and whaaa la just down the street is the hotel,,,and the beggers mostly hang out at the main entrance of the station.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean, ideally situated for airport transport, very helpful staff particularly the legend known as Giovanni the night receptionist who will go out of his way to be helpful, wanting you to have the best possible holiday. Some noise from outside and other rooms but not enough to spoil your stay. If you enjoy walking all major sites are accessable on foot. There is a shortcut to Termini station by turning left at the top of the street where the coaches stop. Giovanni's recomendation of the Severa 2000 is spot on. good family type food, plenty of it and a good price. Three course tourist menu €15 including a drink. Luggage can be left in reception if you have a late departure.

Reviews.Title: “recommend the piemonte”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and thought it was excellent value for money - 70 euros per night for a double room which included a great continental breakfast. The room was small but cosy and very well decorated and spotlessly clean as was the en suite bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful and advised on places to go as well as areas and bus routes to avoid. Although the Termini area is not an attractive part of the city the hotel was in quite a quiet and well lit street and was ideally placed for travel both around the city and to and from the airport - the drop off point for the Ryanair coach from Ciampino airport is just around the corner. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying here. It was nice and clean and I agree with the comments about the lovely man on the evening shift - he was such a character. However the hotel was SO noisy that my friend and I had difficulty sleeping. We were on the second floor and we could hear everything from the room next door, including when they went to the toilet! And then to make matters worse the maids who started working at around 6am had no worries about standing outside our door and having the longest conversations rather loudly - as well as scraping the beds on the floor next door. I couldn't believe how noisy they were, so early. The bathroom was a good size, great shower and clean. The room was an ok size - fine for just the two of us. We had a twin room and the beds were tiny! And the pillows felt like bricks! But even though there was some things to complain about, all in all the hotel was fine for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have spent 5 days in december 2004 in Rome and while we were searching for a hotel the reviews we have found at tripadvisor.com have been very helpful. Those reviews persuaded me to book the Hotel Piemonte and I must say that this was a very good decision. It is easy to reach and it is a very good starting point to discover Rome because of the close main station Termini. The hotel is indeed very charming. It was completely renovated in 1999 so that everything is looking new. The staff is very fiendly and we also met the often times mentioned older gentleman who is doing the night shift at the hotel and who is very helpful. The breakfast is ok but not outstanding. We can also recommend a little restaurant very close to the hotel. It is not looking very luxurious, but the meals (expecially the bruscetta) and the prices are great. Just go right when you leave the hotel, then turn directly right again and almost at the end of the road you will find "Dino´s" Restaurant. When booking the hotel better ask for a room on the second floor: we have been on the groundfloor and there you could hear the telephone ringing at the reception and the coffee machine in the breakfast room, but it was not too loud. Have a great time at the Hotel Piemonte!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for several days in September. It was clean and nicely furnished. The shower, although small, was larger than any other in Europe we encountered during our stay. The staff spoke English and was very helpful making sure we made our early flight out on our last day. The night clerk arranged our cab and stayed after his shift the next morning to set up breakfast early, just for us, so that we could grab a quick bite! It was a bit further to major attractions than we thought (about a 35 minute walk to the Colosseum, but you see so much of the city on foot). For the less foot-hardy, the metro is but two blocks away and is relatively easy to use. It's a quick 8 minute ride to the Vatican. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Piemonte Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Piemonte was great value for money. The rooms were a trifle small but they were spotless and comfortable enough for a City Break. Surrounding area is not the most salubrious of places, but was fine for metro, buses etc... Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The was a very nice hotel in a good location (near the Termini) and reasonably priced. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: twinkee
Reviews.Content: When I first went into our room I was a bit disappointed as it was quite small but then I noticed it had a balcony of sorts that gave the room a bigger feel. The staff were very friendly, there is an older man who was there late evening, he advised us of places to go, to eat where to avoid, buses etc. His information was very useful and appreciated but he did advise us against a very nice Korean restaurant as he said it was too expensive, we went there and it was lovely and reasonably priced. He also advised us not to go to the market because of pick pockets, we went anyway and it was ok, I guess you just have to be alert. From the hotel we walked to the main sites, Fountain, Steps and Colosseum, if you enjoy walking then this hotel would be ideal as you are not right on top of the main sites and you see a bit more walking to them. There is a bus to the Caimpino airport which was 8 euros and runs from a hotel round the corner. Also round the corner from the hotel was Ristorante Bistro and Ristorante de Nazzareno, both very nice places with staff to match. Only down side of the hotel was that I could hear next door everytime they flushed the loo, which wasn't a good enougth reason not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location in rome. The Ryanair bus from the airport dropped us around the corner from the hotel and collected us from the same place which was extremely convenient. The train station is just around the corner. The rooms are spotless and modern and the breakfast is lovely with delicious fresh food. There are also a couple of lovely restaurants nearby. The staff are very helpful particularly Giovanni on the night desk. He is very entertaining and is interested in assisting every guest to enjoy their time in Rome. He knew everything from the best bars and restaurants to bus routes and the best tourist sites to visit. I would definitely stay here again.
